revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name=Jake Johannsen |birth_date={{birth date and age|1960|7|28}} |birth_place=[[Iowa City, Iowa]], U.S. }} '''Jake Johannsen''' (born July 28, 1960) is an American comedian.
Johannsen attended [[Iowa State University]] in the early 1980s, originally majoring in [[veterinary medicine]], and then later changing to chemical engineering. He left after three years in college and relocated to [[San Francisco, California]], in order to pursue a career in comedy. Johannsen made his debut at [[Cobb's Comedy Club]] in San Francisco, and by 1986 had won the 11th Annual [[San Francisco International Comedy Competition]].<ref>http://www.dead-frog.com/comedians/comic/jake_johannsen/</ref>
During the 1990s, Johannsen starred in his own [[Home Box Office|HBO]] comedy special, ''This'll Take About an Hour'',<ref>http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-1102476.html</ref> which was listed as one of the Ten Best Television Shows by ''[[People Magazine]]'' in 1992. In 1994, he was nominated as "Best Male Stand-Up Comedian" for the 1994 American Comedy Awards.<ref>http://www.bluemoontalent.com/jake-johannsen.html</ref>
According to [[Jerry Seinfeld]], Johannsen was originally wanted for the role of [[George Costanza]] in [[Seinfeld]], but he refused the part.<ref>http://www.accesshollywood.com/how-did-jerry-seinfeld-go-about-casting-seinfeld-2004_video_1415714</ref>
In 2010, Johannsen starred in his second Comedy Special titled ''I Love You'', which aired on [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] and was directed and produced by [[the Aristocrats (film)|The Aristocrats]] editor [[Emery Emery]].
Johannsen also was the star headliner of the inaugural Iowa Comedy Festival.<ref>http://www.iacomedyfest.wordpress.com</ref> Johannsen performed October 16, 2010, at People's Court in downtown Des Moines to cap off the four-day event.
Johannsen is a favorite of [[David Letterman]] and on May 20, 2011, made his 40th appearance on the ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]''. He and his wife, actress Belinda Waymouth, have one child.
